page.title: 16EDUCATION IN KINGS LANGLEY
page.content: {SCHOOLS}_ In 1984 the Infant School (built in 1838) was closed and transfered to combine with the Junior School in a new extension. Most pupils attend the Local Authority primary and secondary schools situated on the west side of the A41. Traffic patrols safeguard the safety of the children crossing the busy roads. The Independent Rudolph Steiner School providing for children from primary age to sixth form, occupies the site of the former Royal Palace built by King EDward I and uses a building, known as the Priory (The remains of the Dominican Friary consecrated in 1312) Nothing remains today of the 13th century Royal Palace other than written evidence from archaeological excavations of 1962, 1970 and 1974_76.
